description: This is the protocol for making and running a 12% SDS-PAGE Western blot. Protocol starts from pouring gels all the way to reading the membrane.
before_start:
Run a BCA assay before starting a Western Blot

Make 10% AP fresh each time you pour gels. Mix 0.1 grams of AP with 100 microliters of waters.
guidelines: Not all Western blots are going to work out. Prepare for failures.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Spray the glass plates with 70% ethanol before use and dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spray the glass plates with 70% ethanol before use and dry.

components.data: Obtain materials Western Blot Gel Pouring Apparatus: green casting stands, 4 large glass plates, 4 small glass plates, plastic Western Blot holder for the casting stands, and combs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Obtain materials Western Blot Gel Pouring Apparatus: green casting stands, 4 large glass plates, 4 small glass plates, plastic Western Blot holder for the casting stands, and combs.

components.data: Place small plate on top of the large plates. Slide these two glasses into the green casting stands, making sure that the glass plates are even. Close the casting stand and clip them in place on the plastic Western Blot gel holders.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place small plate on top of the large plates. Slide these two glasses into the green casting stands, making sure that the glass plates are even. Close the casting stand and clip them in place on the plastic Western Blot gel holders.

components.data: Grab the following materials for 12% SDS-PAGE gels: Lower buffer (Tris 0.5M-pH 8.8), upper buffer (Tris 1.5M-pH 6.8), water, 30% Acrylamide-Bis 37.5:1, 10% SDS, 10% AP, and TEMED.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grab the following materials for 12% SDS-PAGE gels: Lower buffer (Tris 0.5M-pH 8.8), upper buffer (Tris 1.5M-pH 6.8), water, 30% Acrylamide-Bis 37.5:1, 10% SDS, 10% AP, and TEMED.

*Lower buffer: 1.5M Tris base pH8.8

**Upper buffer: 0.5M Tris pH6.8

Weigh 30.25g of Tris base, dissolve in 350ml H2O.

            Adjust to pH6.8 with concentrated HCl.

            Make up to 500ml with H2O.

components.data: After making the resolving gel, use a 1000 microliter pipette to distribute the solution from the tube into the space between the glass plates. Stop pipetting the solution when you reach the bottom of the green section of the casting stand behind the glass plates. After pouring the gels, pipette some isopropanol on the top of the resolving gel to prevent evaporation. Let it polymerize for about 30 minutes or so. Use leftover solution from tube as a check to whether the gel is done polymerizing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After making the resolving gel, use a 1000 microliter pipette to distribute the solution from the tube into the space between the glass plates. Stop pipetting the solution when you reach the bottom of the green section of the casting stand behind the glass plates. After pouring the gels, pipette some isopropanol on the top of the resolving gel to prevent evaporation. Let it polymerize for about 30 minutes or so. Use leftover solution from tube as a check to whether the gel is done polymerizing.

components.data:
While the resolving gel is polymerizing, make the stacking gel but don't add the TEMED until you're ready to pour the stacking gel in. Follow the recipe below for the stacking gel.

components.data: Once the resolving gel is done polymerizing, dump out the isopropanol in the sink and rinse with water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once the resolving gel is done polymerizing, dump out the isopropanol in the sink and rinse with water.

components.data: Add the TEMED  to your stacking gel solution and distribute the solution with the pipette until you reach the top of the short glass plate. Add the comb of your choice and make sure there is no bubbles. Let it polymerize for about 30 minutes. Use your tube of left over solution as a check.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the TEMED  to your stacking gel solution and distribute the solution with the pipette until you reach the top of the short glass plate. Add the comb of your choice and make sure there is no bubbles. Let it polymerize for about 30 minutes. Use your tube of left over solution as a check.

components.data: After the gel is done polymerizing, you can store gels by wrapping them with moist paper towel and placing them in 4 degrees Celsius fridge until you're ready to use them.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the gel is done polymerizing, you can store gels by wrapping them with moist paper towel and placing them in 4 degrees Celsius fridge until you're ready to use them.

components.data: Grab materials for running a gel: Western blot running container, lid with electrodes, 1X tank buffer, gels, samples, buffer dam (if running one gel), and gel holders.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grab materials for running a gel: Western blot running container, lid with electrodes, 1X tank buffer, gels, samples, buffer dam (if running one gel), and gel holders.

components.data: Place gels inside the gel holders and have the short plate and wells facing the interior of the gel holder.If you are only running one gel, use a buffer dam on the other side of your gels. Close them in place. Place the gels inside the tank.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place gels inside the gel holders and have the short plate and wells facing the interior of the gel holder.If you are only running one gel, use a buffer dam on the other side of your gels. Close them in place. Place the gels inside the tank.

components.data: Before running the gel, make sure your samples have been denatured with sample buffer. If not, add the sample buffer to your samples and boil them for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Before running the gel, make sure your samples have been denatured with sample buffer. If not, add the sample buffer to your samples and boil them for 5 minutes.

components.data: Fill the tank with 1X tank buffer until it reaches the appropriate line for how many gels you are running. Fill the interior of the gel holder with tank buffer to the very top.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fill the tank with 1X tank buffer until it reaches the appropriate line for how many gels you are running. Fill the interior of the gel holder with tank buffer to the very top.

components.data: Load 10 microliters of the ladder of your choice into the first well. Transfer all your samples from the Eppendorf tubes into the wells of your gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Load 10 microliters of the ladder of your choice into the first well. Transfer all your samples from the Eppendorf tubes into the wells of your gel.

components.data: Place the lid on top of your Western blot apparatus with the electrodes matching with the corresponding color. Plug cables into the corresponding colors on the Western blot machines.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the lid on top of your Western blot apparatus with the electrodes matching with the corresponding color. Plug cables into the corresponding colors on the Western blot machines.

components.data: Run the gel for 1 hour at 160V. Check on your gel every 8-10 minutes to make sure your gel isn't leaking with the tank buffer. Pause the machine and use a pipette to move buffer from the tank into the gel holder if it's leaking.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run the gel for 1 hour at 160V. Check on your gel every 8-10 minutes to make sure your gel isn't leaking with the tank buffer. Pause the machine and use a pipette to move buffer from the tank into the gel holder if it's leaking.

components.data: Grab the following materials to make the transfer 'sandwich': transfer tank and lid, small magnetic stir bar, ice pack, transfer electrodegel cassette, 2 sponges,  Whatman blot paper, Immobilon membrane, 1X transfer buffer, methanol, one plastic tub to fit membrane, and another tub to fill with transfer buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grab the following materials to make the transfer 'sandwich': transfer tank and lid, small magnetic stir bar, ice pack, transfer electrodegel cassette, 2 sponges,  Whatman blot paper, Immobilon membrane, 1X transfer buffer, methanol, one plastic tub to fit membrane, and another tub to fill with transfer buffer.

components.data: Dislodge your gel from the glass plates after the run. Use a razor blase to cut away the stacking gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dislodge your gel from the glass plates after the run. Use a razor blase to cut away the stacking gel.

components.data: Fill a small plastic tub with methanol and pre-wet the Immobilon membrane with it to activate it.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fill a small plastic tub with methanol and pre-wet the Immobilon membrane with it to activate it.

components.data: Assemble your sandwich as follows: Black side of the cassette, sponge, Whatman blotting paper, gel, Immobilon membrane, blotting paper, sponge, clear side of the cassette. Use the transfer buffer to keep the sandwich wet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Assemble your sandwich as follows: Black side of the cassette, sponge, Whatman blotting paper, gel, Immobilon membrane, blotting paper, sponge, clear side of the cassette. Use the transfer buffer to keep the sandwich wet.

components.data: Close the sandwich and insert it into the transfer electrode with the black side of the cassette matching the black side of the electrode.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Close the sandwich and insert it into the transfer electrode with the black side of the cassette matching the black side of the electrode.

components.data: Insert the transfer electrode into the transfer tank. Put the magnetic stir bar on the bottom of the tank and place the ice pack inside as well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Insert the transfer electrode into the transfer tank. Put the magnetic stir bar on the bottom of the tank and place the ice pack inside as well.
Fill the tank with 1X transfer buffer.

components.data: Put on the lid with the electrode matching the colors on the lid and plug the cables into the machine. Let the gel transfer for 2 hours at 0.4 A and let the stir bar spin at 50 rpm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put on the lid with the electrode matching the colors on the lid and plug the cables into the machine. Let the gel transfer for 2 hours at 0.4 A and let the stir bar spin at 50 rpm.

components.data: The methanol and transfer buffer doesn't go down the sink and so can be re-used. Pour these back into their original containers.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The methanol and transfer buffer doesn't go down the sink and so can be re-used. Pour these back into their original containers.

components.data: After the transfer is done, place your membrane in a clear plastic container and put about 5 mL of blocking buffer in the container. Put this on a rocker and let it block for 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the transfer is done, place your membrane in a clear plastic container and put about 5 mL of blocking buffer in the container. Put this on a rocker and let it block for 1 hour.

components.data: After blocking is done, dump the blocking buffer out. Pour the primary antibodies in the container and let it rock overnight in the cold room.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After blocking is done, dump the blocking buffer out. Pour the primary antibodies in the container and let it rock overnight in the cold room.

components.data: While your membrane is blocking, thaw your primary antibodies.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: While your membrane is blocking, thaw your primary antibodies.

components.data: After letting the primary antibodies rock overnight, pour it back into the original container. Grab your secondary antibodies and let it thaw.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After letting the primary antibodies rock overnight, pour it back into the original container. Grab your secondary antibodies and let it thaw.

components.data: Wash your membrane three times with 1X PBS-Tween.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash your membrane three times with 1X PBS-Tween.

components.data: After washing, pour on your secondary antibodies after it has completely thawed. Secondary antibodies are light sensitive so wrap your container with aluminum foil.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After washing, pour on your secondary antibodies after it has completely thawed. Secondary antibodies are light sensitive so wrap your container with aluminum foil.

components.data: Place your container on a rocker and let it rock for 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place your container on a rocker and let it rock for 1 hour.

components.data: After 1 hour, wash the membrane three times with 1X PBS-Tween. Keep your container wrapped in foil while washing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After 1 hour, wash the membrane three times with 1X PBS-Tween. Keep your container wrapped in foil while washing.

components.data: After washing the membrane, take it out of the container and dry the membrane with 2 Whatman blotting papers before analyzing it with the LI-COR machines.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After washing the membrane, take it out of the container and dry the membrane with 2 Whatman blotting papers before analyzing it with the LI-COR machines.

components.data: Use the LI-COR machines to analyze your membrane.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use the LI-COR machines to analyze your membrane.

components.data: Roll over your sandwich with a Sharpie marker to get rid of any bubbles.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Roll over your sandwich with a Sharpie marker to get rid of any bubbles.
